abstract.text: Learn about the postback parameters in all SKAdNetwork versions.

metadata.title: Identifying the parameters in install-validation postbacks

inlineContent.text: The following list describes all the possible parameters you may get in a postback, and their version availability. To verify that Apple signed the postback, see
Version 2 and later. The SKAdNetwork version that matches
or
. For more information about versions, see
Version 1 and later. Your ad network ID, which matches the value you provide for
or
Version 2 and later. Apple’s attribution signature that you verify.
Version 1 and later. The App Store app ID of the advertised app.
Version 4 and later. The hierarchical source identifier that replaces the
. This string represents two, three, or four digits of the original value the ad network supplies in
or
Versions 1–3. The campaign identifer you provide when displaying the ad, which matches
or
. Version 4 and later ads use
instead.
Version 2 and later. The App Store app ID of the app that displays the ad. The
value matches
or

only appears in the postback if providing the parameter meets Apple’s privacy threshold.
Version 4 and later, for web ads only. For more information, see
Version 2 and later. An unsigned 6-bit value that the installed app sets by calling a method to update the conversion value, such as
. The
only appears in the postback if the installed app provides it, and if providing the parameter meets Apple’s privacy threshold.

Version 3 and later. A Boolean value that’s
if the ad network wins the attribution, and

Version 2.2 and later. A value of
indicates a view-through ad presentation; a value of

Version 4 and later. The possible integer values of

Version 2 and later. A Boolean value of
indicates that a device with the customer’s Apple ID previously installed the app.
Version 1 and later. A unique value for this validation; use it to deduplicate install-validation postbacks.

To ensure crowd anonymity, Apple assigns a postback data tier to app downloads. The postback data tier determines whether certain parameters appear in the postback, as well as the number of digits in the hierarchical source identifer. The following postback parameters are subject to the postback data tier:
(affects the number of digits the postback returns)
For more information about receiving postbacks, see

abstract.text: Attribute app-install campaigns that originate on the web.
Support In-App Purchases and interactions with the App Store.
A number that represents the advertising network’s campaign.
A string that represents the advertising network’s unique identifier.
The App Store ID of the app that displays the ad.
A four-digit integer that ad networks define to represent the ad campaign.
The version of the SKAdNetwork API.
A class that validates advertisement-driven app installations.
Updates the fine and coarse conversion values and indicates whether to send the postback before the conversion window ends, and calls a completion handler if the update fails.
The key that represents the advertising network’s campaign.
The key that represents the advertising network’s unique identifier.
The key that represents the App Store ID of the app that displays the ad.
A four-digit integer that ad networks define to represent the ad campaign.
The key that represents the version of the ad network API.
Learn about the data that postbacks may contain in each conversion window.

doc://com.apple.storekit/documentation/S.title: Receiving postbacks in multiple conversion windows

abstract.text: Learn about the features in each SKAdNetwork version.
Ensure the validity of a postback you receive after an ad conversion by verifying its cryptographic signature.
